<<<api>>>: Java Generics
<<<code>>>:
```java
public class ConvertSetToDelimitedString {
    public static <T> String convertSetToDelimitedString(Set<T> set, T delimiter) {
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        for (T element : set) {
            if (sb.length() > 0) {
                sb.append(delimiter);
            }
            sb.append(element);
        }
        return sb.toString();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the above function to convert any set with different data types into a string separated by a specified delimiter. The function takes a set and a delimiter as input and returns a string with the elements separated by the delimiter. The function uses a StringBuilder to build the string and appends the elements to it, separated by the delimiter if there is any.
